flowRoot.flowPara: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Mauris ac massa vestibulum nisl facilisis viverra. Morbi volutpat. Donec interdum vestibulum libero. Pellentesque et arcu. Vivamus quis mi. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Quisque arcu ante, cursus in, ornare quis, viverra ut, justo. Aliquam sed erat. Vivamus nisi elit, nonummy id, facilisis non, blandit ac, dolor. Quisque vehicula porttitor odio. Aenean ultrices turpis.
You can monitor and administer several servers at the same time. Just add it with a single click and your machine will make sure look out for it's buddies.
Cockpit is perfect for new sysadmins, allowing them to easy do simple tasks such as storage administration, inspecting journals and start and stop services.

Jumping between the terminal and the web tool is no problem. A service started via Cockpit can be stopped via the terminal. Likewise, if there error in the terminal, it can be seen in the web interfaces journal.
Cockpit is free software and released under the LGPL
Cockpit is a server manager that makes it easy to administer your GNU/Linux servers via a web browser.

text.tspan: File a bug in the issue tracker
Project IRC channel is #Cockpit on Freenode.net

flowRoot.flowPara: You can monitor and administer several servers at the same time. Just add it with a single click and your machine will make sure look out for it's buddies.
Cockpit is perfect for new sysadmins, allowing them to easy do simple tasks such as storage administration, inspecting journals and start and stop services.

Jumping between the terminal and the web tool is no problem. A service started via Cockpit can be stopped via the terminal. Likewise, if there error in the terminal, it can be seen in the web interfaces journal.
Cockpit is free software and released under the LGPL
Cockpit is under heavy development and it's advised you only run it in a virtual machine for now
You can monitor and administer several servers at the same time. Just add it with a single click and your machine will make sure look out for it's buddies.
Cockpit is perfect for new sysadmins, allowing them to easy do simple tasks such as storage administration, inspecting journals and start and stop services.

Jumping between the terminal and the web tool is no problem. A service started via Cockpit can be stopped via the terminal. Likewise, if there error in the terminal, it can be seen in the web interfaces journal.
Cockpit is free software and released under the LGPL
Cockpit is a server manager that makes it easy to administer your GNU/Linux servers via a web browser.
Cockpit is a server manager that makes it easy to administer your GNU/Linux servers via a web browser.
